availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, laborer and clergyman. Warren County native. Son of William Halsell and Sarah Halsell. Married to Virginia C. Murry Halsell in Warren County on January 16, 1856. Father of Stella Halsell and Nannie Halsell. Laborer in Warren County in 1850. Clergyman in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, p. 154.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 125.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000164006, p. 1.
Find A Grave, "James M. Halsell (1834-1902)," Memorial #50565571, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50565571 (accessed October 9, 2018).
